articles.author: Alexandra Ulmer, Gram Slattery
articles.description: Some Republican officials, donors and advisers said Donald Trump, the Republican presidential candidate, had botched his debate with Democratic Vice President Kamala Harris although Trump himself praised his performance.
articles.title: While Trump touts his debate performance, allies, donors and advisers lament it

articles.author: Ted Hesson, Andy Sullivan, Gabriella Borter
articles.description: Haitian Americans said they fear for their safety after Donald Trump repeated a false and derogatory claim during this week's presidential debate about immigrants in Ohio.
articles.title: Haitian Americans fear for their safety after Trump repeats false claims about immigrants

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The Palestinian Hamas group said on Wednesday that its negotiators reiterated its readiness to implement an "immediate" ceasefire with Israel in Gaza based on a previous U.S. proposal without new conditions from any party.
articles.title: Hamas says ready to implement ceasefire without new conditions

articles.author: Hyonhee Shin
articles.description: North Korea fired multiple short-range ballistic missiles off its east coast on Thursday, South Korea's military said, the first such launch in more than two months.
articles.title: North Korea fires short-range missiles in first launch in two months

articles.author: Michelle Nichols
articles.description: A lack of accountability for the killing of United Nations staff and humanitarian aid workers in the Gaza Strip is "totally unacceptable," U.N. Secretary-General Antonio Guterres told Reuters in a wide-ranging interview on Wednesday.
articles.title: UN chief says lack of accountability on UN staff killings in Gaza 'unacceptable'

articles.author: Mark Trevelyan
articles.description: Russia should clearly state its willingness to use nuclear weapons against countries that "support NATO aggression in Ukraine", according to an influential foreign policy hawk who is pressing President Vladimir Putin to adopt a more assertive nuclear posture towards the West.
articles.title: Russian hawk pushes case for Putin to toughen policy on nuclear weapons

articles.author: Daphne Psaledakis, Barbara Erling
articles.description: U.S. Secretary of State Antony Blinken will meet with senior Polish government officials on Thursday to discuss support for Ukraine in its fight against Russia and deepening U.S. defense cooperation with Warsaw.
articles.title: Blinken to discuss support for Ukraine in visit to Poland

articles.author: Michelle Nichols
articles.description: The United States supports creating two permanent United Nations Security Council seats for African states and one seat to be rotated among small island developing states, U.S. Ambassador to the U.N. Linda Thomas-Greenfield will announce on Thursday.
articles.title: Exclusive: US supports two permanent UN Security Council seats for Africa

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Flood water levels of the Red River in Hanoi are forecast to be little changed until at least early Friday, the government's weather agency said on Thursday, and several parts of the city will remain inundated.
articles.title: Hanoi flood levels to be little changed, parts to remain inundated - weather agency

articles.author: Joshua McElwee
articles.description:
Pope Francis on Thursday urged political leaders in Singapore, a leading global financial hub, to seek fair wages for the country's million-plus lower-paid foreign workers.
In likely the last major speech of an ambitious 12-day tour across Southeast Asia and Oceania, the 87-year-old pontiff singled out concern for Singapore's rapidly ageing population and its migrant workforce, primarily centred i
articles.title: Pope Francis, in Singapore, urges fair wages for migrant workers
